name: Right Leg Calf Raise
how_to_perform:
1. Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart, near a wall or sturdy object for balance, such as a chair or railing. 
2. Place your hands lightly on the wall or object to help stabilize your balance. 
3. Transfer your weight onto your right foot, lifting your left foot off the ground by bending your left knee slightly.
4. Keeping your body straight, slowly lift your right heel off the floor by rising onto the ball of your right foot. Ensure that your ankle and toe alignment remains straight.
5. Hold the top position momentarily while feeling the contraction in your right calf.
6. Slowly lower your right heel back down to the floor, returning to the starting position. 
7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the left leg if needed.
short_summary: Calf raises are an exercise targeting the calves by lifting the heel off the ground while standing on one leg.
